page.title: 04Shenington & Shutford
page.content: The Mill House in Shenington is next to the church. It is the oldest house in Shenington. It was probably built during the 17th century, but has been repaired since. it is a 2 storey building made of ironstone with a Welsh slate roof. It has stone-mullioned windows with square stone decorations, some of the windows blocked. The name of the first owner was Harold Hewins, and Hewin's lived in the house for over 100 years. Mr Court who is a farmer, lives there now. Mill House is a grade 2 listed building. Shutford Manor celebrated its 400th year 6 years ago. Little is known of its history as original documents have disappeared. It belonged to the Saye and Sele family until recent times.
